p: Additionally, there is still ongoing work to develop a vaccine to prevent RSV infection. Recently, one study reported protective immunity against RSV with a molecularly adjuvanted adenovirus serotype 5 based RSV oral vaccine in a rat model ( 69). However, two recent randomized control failed to establish an effect of anti-RSV monoclonal antibodies and recurrent wheeze of early childhood or asthma ( 70â€“ 73).
